Stereotype.name: Vision
Stereotype.notes:
A concise description of the desired future state of an organisation resulting from planned change
  • Describes a future state without necessarily indicating how it will be achieved
  • It can be easily understood by a wide variety of stakeholders
  • It describes a compelling future that engages the heart as well as the head
  • it avoids target dates unless the vision is truly time-dependent
  • It describes a vision that is verifiable but without too many detailed performance targets
  • It is short and memorable

Stereotype.name: Objective
Stereotype.notes: The purpose of some activity or change - the answer to "why" Should start with the word "to" Helpful if it is "SMART"

Stereotype.name: Benefit
Stereotype.notes:
An outcome of change that is perceived as positive by a stakeholder
  • Typically these are outcomes which are valuable to the organisation and measurable
  • Starts with an adjective that indicates the direction of expected improvement e.g. reduced, increased, greater, fewer, better, improved
  • Value likely to change gradually
  • No direct cost associated with it (if it has it's an enabler or change)
  • measures are possible
  • baseline measures could be found

Tag.name: Value Type
Tag.values: Financial Definite,Financial Expected,Financial Logical,Non-Financial Definite,Non-Financial Expected,Non-Financial Logical,Intangible

Stereotype.name: Disbenefit
Stereotype.notes:
An outcome of change that is perceived as negative by a stakeholder
  • Typically these are outcomes which are not valuable to the organisation and measurable
  • Starts with an adjective that indicates the direction of expected change e.g. reduced, increased, greater, fewer, worse
  • Value likely to change gradually
  • No direct cost associated with it (if it has it's an enabler or change)
  • measures are possible
  • baseline measures could be found

Tag.name: Value Type
Tag.values: Financial Definite,Financial Expected,Financial Logical,Non-Financial Definite,Non-Financial Expected,Non-Financial Logical,Intangible

Stereotype.name: Enabler
Stereotype.notes:
An enabler is something that can be developed/built/acquired normally from outside the environment in which it will be embedded and where the benefits will be realised
  • An enabler can be any of the PPIT types: people, Process, Information, Technology
  • An enabler is normally costed, budgeted and formally planned usually within a project or programme
  • enablers include Information, IT Systems, Buildings, Policies, Processes, Skills
  • can be costed
  • you can usually kick it

Stereotype.name: Business Change
Stereotype.notes:
A change which occurs within the business / operational environment often embedding an enabler within the organisation and culture
  • An activity (task, process, piece of work) intended to produce a new business state or benefit
  • Scope includes: people (attitude, values, culture), process (policies, working practices), communication, knowledge sharing, learning, development
  • not ongoing or BAU process
  • starts with an imperative, e.g. investiogate, create, design, implement, appoint, establish
  • defined package of work with clear boundaries

Stereotype.name: Measure
Stereotype.notes: A measure is a metric whose change in the desired direction helps to confirm that the related benefit is being realised

Tag.name: Method
Tag.description: How is the measurement carried out?
